content.description: Tar Baby is the bolted overhang ten feet right of the 5.12d with ancient fixed draws. Start right of the first bolt and step left into the overhang with long reaches to jugs. The rock in the roof is incredible with bubbles, cracks, and a few jugs. Moderate climbing follows to a tricky finish.
content.location: rightward route in the roof. Bolts are hard to spot from the ground

content.description:
Epic fun!! Likely one of the steepest 5.11c routes in Humboldt/Trinity. At bolt #2 the angle steepens impressively and jugs appear. Pull into a little cave to rest before continuing up the "offwidth" which is surrounded by great holds. At the final roof, figure out quickly which way to go, and punch it to the top!

This route had some very very aged fixed draws with 1' tubular webbing dogbones that were quite horrid. It was a pain to clip our draws over them, so we removed them. If you are heading out there and feel like replacing them, or pitching in for some chain, let me know.
content.protection: 7 bolts. Lower off biners up top
content.location: The right most route on the wall. Distinguished by an offwidth looking crack to the left of the bolt line.
